project.objective:
Ensure that a software project's dependencies like language, framework and platforms are easily replaceable. The replacement can be automatic or manual. Ensure that the software project is valid and only uses certain features, that makes it easy to migrate the project. Standardize usage of Java feature by defining a subset of valid Java grammar and checking it. Use different Grammar for Dem and subsequent projects, because Dem is the base for subsequent projects, which should have higher restriction. Only some parts of Dem should use a different/unrestricted part. This part should only be the Java-specific code.
Ensure that the code is easily translatable to other languages with minimal effort and manual work. Support different paradigms. Object-Orientation mainly provides polymorphic tree transformations. Dlang seems to be a good choice. Support a very simple and basic version of functional programming with an simple statically typed object system. The object system, which is kind of an OOP-System only provides state interfaces. The functions define the state transitions of the objects.
Always translate code to other language automatically and test it, in order to be sure that the code is portable. Create a translator which translate other projects to a different language. The translator only has to translate projects complying with this project (compatibility and portability).
This would allow to check additional properties of the program before running it.
